results.title: Berth 24
results.creator_credit: J.B. Holmes, Edgar H. Anstey and British Transport Films
results.brief_description: Describes the ‘turn-round’ of a ship - S.S. Bravo - which plies with freight and passengers between Hull and Gothenburg. For an army of men, from river pilot to Stevedore, each ‘turn-round’ is a test of professional skill, and a race against time if tides are to be caught and schedules kept. The film tells the story of what this means to George Moore, a foreman docker, and to a Swedish passenger who comes to England as a buyer of British goods.

results.title: Berlin: outpost of freedom
results.brief_description: West Berlin is an outpost of freedom in the Russian dominated sector of East Germany, encroached on all sides by Soviet armed strength. Reporting factually on the current Berlin crisis, reviews the main events since World War II which have lead to the present situation. Thousands of refugees have fled from East to West Berlin in a desperate bid to escape the tyranny of the Communist regime. The threat by Russia to change the status of Berlin has become a problem of world proportions. No other credits available.

results.title: Belonging to the group: respect as a human value
results.creator_credit: John T. Bobbitt and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: Shows how an American family and a refugee family from Europe who move at the same time into a typical American community make adjustments and are accepted into groups at school, at work and at church. Discusses the need for people to respect and accept one another in a free society; explains the vital role of groups within a community; emphasises the importance of acquiring the feeling of belonging to a group; indicates community values and their relation to the democratic way of life.

results.title: The Behaviour game
results.creator_credit: Ronald Spender, Barclays Bank and Lion Pacesetter Films
results.brief_description: Designed to show the contagious nature of both good and bad behavior. Opens with the proposition that innate courtesy has been the hallmark of the Englishman, then the scene shifts to one of riotous discourtesy. Ways of improving public and personnel relations are shown together with information on appropriate demeanor at work.

results.title: The Beach: a river of sand
results.creator_credit: Warren Brown, Stanley Croner and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: Shows by an analysis of currents produced by waves and calculations of the accumulation and depletion of sand, that the most pronounced movement of sand is along the seashore. Also illustrates effects of breakwaters and other works.

results.title: The Battle of San Pietro
results.creator_credit: John Huston and United States. Army Pictorial Service
results.brief_description: Presents modern warfare from the soldier’s point of view. Stresses the number of men killed in taking one military objective. Shows how in the Allies Italian campaign, the people of San Pietro were too stunned to realise they had been liberated.

results.title: Basic reproduction processes in the graphic arts
results.brief_description: Explains briefly the four basic printing processes - letterpress, gravure, lithography and silk screen. The general principles are demonstrated as well as the means of preparing images for printing including the linotype and monotype machines, and mechanical and chemical photocopying equipment. Various types of printing presses are shown and reference is made to flexography for the printing of flexible packaging. No other credits available.

results.title: Hydraulics
results.brief_description: Explains the principle of hydraulic pressure and shows how liquids are used to transmit power. Simple working models and laboratory experiments visualise the fundamentals of hydraulic pressure, and some of the ways in which it can be utilised.

results.title: Barefoot
results.creator_credit: C B Wismar, Melvin Hersh, Stan Hersh and Concordia Films
results.brief_description: Worn down on his luck, a frustrated salesman makes his rounds in the noise of the city. He is suddenly surrounded by children who turn his day inside out leaving him free of inhibitions and anger and appreciating life more.
results.creator_credit_for_label: C B Wismar, Melvin Hersh, Stan Hersh and Concordia Films

results.title: Bamboo: plant of a thousand uses
results.creator_credit: Robert Lang, Sterling S Beath and Bailey Film Productions
results.brief_description: Although this is a film about the traditional and everyday uses of bamboo, it also portrays many aspects of contemporary living in Japan; life in urban centres and rural areas and aspects of agriculture, handicrafts, art and types of shelter are explored. This giant grass is noted for its beauty and commercial value and it provides a livelihood for many Japanese families.
